is this code covered by existing tests? Or are those being done in parallel to this in [REEF-1304](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1304)?
@afchung, @markusweimer  I reopened this JIRA, please take a look.
@afchung You were right, I actually need yarn runtime to be initialized even if I don't submit evaluators to it. Added that.
@afchung @markusweimer I have addressed your review comments.
Looks good, I'll test and merge.
Closing (for a second time). It seems that using a simple `ThreadPool` may better serve our purposes here.
@markusweimer @afchung Please take a look.
@afchung, @markusweimer Please take a look.
LGTM
I've done a pass.

I've done a syntax-level pass. Regarding the design: Can you expand on what changed here, preferably on the JIRA? The commit message doesn't capture the breadth of the changes and I have trouble parsing how they relate to the bug encountered.
@markusweimer Updated the JIRA with detailed description of the fix
@markusweimer Addressed the comments and pushed new version.
I'll do a pass.

The locking in `TaskRuntime.RunTask` is confusing to me. It updates the task status, which triggers heartbeats, right? How do we make sure that no other, conflicting, heartbeats are sent at the same time?
Similarly, there is no locking around `TaskRuntime._currentStatus`, right?
LGTM, besides the questions I raised above. But those are equally valid for the code prior to this change, so I am +1 on merging.

@markusweimer Thanks for the concern! You're right, nothing is formally validated, but given what I know, `_currentStatus` and `HeartbeatManager` are thread safe objects. Provided that `HeartbeatManager` sends heartbeats sequentially, task status heartbeats are all sent based on the same `_currentStatus` object, and `_currentStatus` provides conflict checks when its state is updated, it does not seem likely that conflicting heartbeats regarding Tasks will be sent -- however, it is possible that heartbeats are sent with conflicting statuses in Evaluator and Task, as heartbeats regarding Evaluators are triggered from another thread.

This doesn't seem to pertain to this particular PR though.
The JIRA link is broken in your commit message.
Does your test validate that it is testing what it's meant to test for now?

@afchung The problem with the test was that it did not bound the right environment. I don't think that in E2E test I can validate more then successful execution. I did validate manually (by looking on logs) that correct env was launched.
@shulmanb done with a first pass.
@afchung Pushed version that addresses your comments and answered your questions. Please take a look.

> it does not seem likely that conflicting heartbeats regarding Tasks will be sent.

Famous last words :) We actually had that bug in java. 

> This doesn't seem to pertain to this particular PR though.

Agreed. Will test and merge.
This is blocked by #983, right?

@markusweimer No. It is not. For bootstrapping the driver config generated differently in the bootstrapping code directly. In #983 the bug is on the client side.

@afchung updated PR.
Is this covered by the Poison tests? If not, we might want to have a test in this PR to make sure we can't regress.
@markusweimer The tests will be part of [REEF-1286](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1286). @tcNickolas do you have other coverage in Poison?

I'm working on REEF-1304 to extend Poison coverage from one `PoisonTest` to the whole series. But the new tests don't check this behavior.
I agree that we need a test for this. Can this change be done after REEF-1304?

Loos good to me. Will merge after:
1.  @markusweimer signs off.
2. Confirming test passes on a YARN cluster.
@tcNickolas why does REEF-1304 block this?

REEF-1304 doesn't _block_ this. If you want to modify some existing Poison test to verify this functionality, it's better to do this after REEF-1304, because it refactors the one PoisonTest we have significantly. If you want to do a standalone test, it's completely unrelated.
@markusweimer Can you please take a look?
Note to whomever merges this (likely self): Please fix the commit message. The JIRA link is broken.
@markusweimer I can rebase and fix the commit message (I thought I did it already). Let me know if I should do that.

@markusweimer there was some misunderstanding here that @tcNickolas and I discussed offline. This should not wait for REEF-1304.

This would not require substantial changes to PoisonTest because PoisonTest triggers failures on `IClock` `Alarm` s, which are ultimately still observed by the `IClock` thread. Should the user spin off another thread that triggers an unhandled Exception in their own `Task`, the behavior currently will not catch the Exception message in the `FailedEvaluator` event.
I did a pass and also left some comments on JIRA.
Looks good to me overall, few minor comments.

@markusweimer Sure, that can be done, but the test will need to be modified with REEF-1286 to test for correct Serialization again.

I've updated PR. It doesn't include tests which have evaluator without context, because it turns out it's very hard to catch such a moment in life of evaluator.

I got a test failure, and the test run hang at the end:

```
INFO: Running test bb8beabe. If failed AND log uploaded is enabled, log can be find in 2016-05-04\bb8beabe
    Org.Apache.REEF.Tests.Functional.Bridge.TestSuspendTask.TestSuspendTaskOnLocalRuntime [FAIL]      Cannot read from log file D:\src\reef\lang\cs\bin\x64\Debug\Org.Apache.REEF.Tests\REEF_LOCAL_RUNTIMEf22f388d\re
ef-testSuspendTask-20160504095344317\driver\driver.stdout
      Expected: True
      Actual:   False
      Stack Trace:
        Functional\ReefFunctionalTest.cs(251,0): at Org.Apache.REEF.Tests.Functional.ReefFunctionalTest.ReadLogFile(S
tring logFileName, String subfolder, String testFolder)
        Functional\ReefFunctionalTest.cs(159,0): at Org.Apache.REEF.Tests.Functional.ReefFunctionalTest.ValidateSucce
ssForLocalRuntime(Int32 numberOfContextsToClose, Int32 numberOfTasksToFail, Int32 numberOfEvaluatorsToFail, String te
stFolder)
        Functional\Bridge\TestSuspendTask.cs(58,0): at Org.Apache.REEF.Tests.Functional.Bridge.TestSuspendTask.TestSu
spendTaskOnLocalRuntime()
```
@markusweimer looks like the test has trouble reading the log file. Does the log file itself indicate any errors? This change seems orthogonal to that test.

I uploaded the `bin` folder of the hanging test [here](https://onedrive.live.com/redir?resid=5801726772BFC3DA!278771&authkey=!ANAS4VbWJVevr24&ithint=folder%2ctxt). It seems to have been a fluke, as subsequent test runs worked fine.
